title: Two Arrested for €88m Louvre Jewel Theft, Admit Partial Involvement
snippets: Louvre heist suspects 'partially admit' involvement, stolen jewels still missing Reuters
The Paris prosecutor says the jewels are not yet recovered and there could be a bigger gang behind the theft.
The suspects face charges for theft committed by an organised gang and criminal conspiracy, prosecutor says.

Police are no closer to recovering gems valued at £76m, despite the arrest of two men last week Two men arrested on suspicion of stealing crown jewels worth an estimated €88m (£76m) from the Louvre in Paris have “partially admitted” their role in the heist, the prosecutor has said, but police are no
None of France’s crown jewels have been recovered. Paris’s public prosecutor said she remains hopeful, with two suspects in custody.
The Paris prosecutor overseeing the case said the two men face 15 years in prison for stealing some of France’s crown jewels, while two other suspects have yet to be caught.
titles: Louvre heist suspects 'partially admit' involvement, stolen jewels still missing - Reuters
Two suspects partially admit involvement in Louvre heist, prosecutor says
Two suspects in Louvre heist partially admit involvement: Paris prosecutor
Louvre suspects ‘partially admit’ their role in jewel heist
Louvre heist suspects ‘partially admitted’ involvement
2 Louvre Heist Suspects Have ‘Partially Admitted’ to the Crime
summary: Two men arrested for stealing jewels worth approximately €88m (£76m) from the Louvre in Paris have partially admitted their involvement, according to the Paris prosecutor. Despite their arrest, the stolen jewels remain missing, and there is speculation of a larger gang's involvement. They face charges of theft by an organized gang and criminal conspiracy, with a potential 15-year prison sentence. Police efforts to recover the stolen items continue, with two additional suspects still at large.

title: Israel Launches Airstrikes on Gaza, Citing Ceasefire Violations by Hamas
snippets: Israel's military said the ceasefire in Gaza resumed after it carried out heavy airstrikes overnight that killed 104 people, including 46 children, according to local health officials.

Israel military says resumed Gaza ceasefire after series of airstrikes Al Arabiya English
Israel resumes Gaza ceasefire after 104 Palestinians killed in airstrikes Axios

The Israeli military said on Wednesday that it will abide by a ceasefire accord in Gaza, as health officials in the enclave said airstrikes had killed 104 people, with both sides trading blame for violations of the deal.
Israeli Army Says Ceasefire in Gaza Resumed After Strikes Bloomberg.com

Prime minister accuses Hamas of ‘clear violation’ of truce as far-right ministers clamour to resume war Israeli warplanes struck Gaza on Tuesday night, shortly after Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, ordered the military to carry out “powerful strikes” in Gaza, in the most serious test of
The office of the Israeli prime minister said Tuesday evening that he had ordered “forceful strikes,” accusing Hamas of firing on Israeli troops and failing to return hostages’ bodies.
titles: Israel says it's resuming the ceasefire after its strikes in Gaza kill over 100 people

summary: Israel has resumed airstrikes on Gaza, accusing Hamas of violating a US-brokered ceasefire by attacking Israeli troops and mishandling the return of hostage remains. Despite these allegations, Hamas denies responsibility for the attacks and criticizes the Israeli strikes. The escalation marks a significant test of the ceasefire, with Netanyahu ordering "powerful strikes" in response. Emergency crews have been shown rescuing civilians from the aftermath in Gaza City.

title: Dow Down, S&P 500 Flat as Powell Signals Uncertain December Rate Cut
snippets: Dow ends down, S&P 500 flat as Powell says December rate cut far from assured Reuters
Fed meeting live: Powell says don't count on a December rate cut Reuters
Gold pares gains after Fed Powell's comments despite rate cut Reuters
Powell's comments curb December rate cut bets, boosting dollar Reuters
U.S. Treasury yields rose on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve cut interest rates for the second time this year.
Fed Chair Powell Says December Interest Rate Cut Is ‘Far From’ Guaranteed Investopedia
Powell Says December Rate Cut ‘Far From’ Foregone Conclusion Bloomberg.com
Powell Says Rate Cut in December Is Far From Foregone Conclusion Bloomberg.com
The Fed will stop shrinking its $7 trillion balance sheet in December, but Powell stressed it’s a pause in quantitative tightening, rather than a new phase of easing.

Fed meeting live: Powell says don't count on a December rate cut - Reuters

summary: The Dow closed down and the S&P 500 remained flat after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell indicated that a December interest rate cut is far from certain. Powell's comments also led to a reduction in expectations for a December rate cut, causing the U.S. dollar to strengthen and Treasury yields to rise. Despite the Federal Reserve cutting interest rates for the second time this year, Powell emphasized that the decision to pause its quantitative tightening in December does not signal a shift towards easing monetary policy.

Agreement will reduce auto tariffs on Seoul to 15% in return for $350bn of investment in US
The trade agreement will lower U.S. tariffs on Korean cars and parts to 15 percent in exchange for $350 billion in investment, a Korean official said.

summary: South Korea and the U.S. have finalized a trade deal after months of negotiations, as confirmed by both countries. The agreement, welcomed by Hyundai Motor and markets, will lower U.S. tariffs on Korean cars and parts to 15% in exchange for $350 billion in investment from Seoul. This development follows a period of discussions and diplomatic efforts, including flattery from South Korea, leading to a compromise that has been positively received by both parties.

title: D66 Leads Dutch Polls, Jetten Poised to Be First Gay PM, Wilders Declines
snippets: Centrist D66 party leads in Dutch election exit polls, narrowly ahead of far right Reuters
Rob Jetten's D66 party celebrates, two years after his party languished in fifth place in the last vote.
Centrist party D66 came ahead by a thin margin, exit polls suggested. The vote would signal a weakening of the far-right Freedom Party (PVV), which had come in first in the last election.

Result would pave the way for the Netherlands’ first out gay prime minister and end far-right populist Geert Wilders’ time in power The liberal-progressive D66 party was on track to become the largest in the Dutch parliament, according to an exit poll, after a snap general election in which Geert Wi
titles: Centrist D66 party leads in Dutch election exit polls, narrowly ahead of far right - Reuters

summary: In the Dutch general election, the centrist D66 party, led by Rob Jetten, is leading in exit polls, narrowly surpassing the far-right Freedom Party (PVV). This marks a significant shift from the last election, where D66 was in fifth place and PVV led. The outcome suggests a potential for the Netherlands to have its first openly gay prime minister and signifies a decline in support for far-right populist Geert Wilders.

title: Springer Misses World Series Game 5, Bichette DH as Blue Jays Adjust
snippets: Blue Jays DH George Springer won't start Game 5 of the World Series against the Dodgers, but Toronto manager John Schneider indicated he could be available off the bench.
Blue Jays slugger George Springer is out of the Game 5 lineup against the Dodgers after a right-side injury, but is expected to be available off the bench.

The Toronto Blue Jays will have to pick up another win in the World Series without George Springer . The 36-year-old was not in the starting lineup Wednesday for Game 5 of the World Series against the Los Angeles Dodgers missing his second game after suffering an injury to his right side in Game 3. Bo Bichette will once again take Springer’s spot as designated hitter and will remain third in the batting order. Davis Schneider will also hit in the leadoff position as Toronto looks to bring a series lead back to Toronto in Game 5 (Sportsnet, 8 p.m. ET / 5 p.m. PT). Speaking to reporters before...
titles: Jays' Springer feeling better, won't start Game 5

summary: George Springer, the Blue Jays DH, is out of the starting lineup for Game 5 of the World Series against the Dodgers due to a right-side injury sustained in Game 3. However, Toronto's manager John Schneider has stated that Springer could be available off the bench. Bo Bichette will replace him as the designated hitter, batting third, while Davis Schneider will lead off. The Blue Jays aim to secure a win without Springer to take a series lead back to Toronto.

title: Italy to Host 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan-Cortina and Surrounding Areas
snippets: Olympic athletes in February will compete in Milan-Cortina, Italy and three other mountain clusters. The Games will mostly make use of existing infrastructure, though some venues are being renovated or built from scratch.

summary: In February 2026, Olympic athletes will compete in the Winter Games across Milan-Cortina, Italy, and three additional mountain clusters. The event, marking Italy's first Winter Games in 20 years, will primarily utilize existing infrastructure, with some venues undergoing renovations or being newly constructed. The opening ceremony will take place at Milan's San Siro Stadium.

title: France Redefines Rape in Law After Gisèle Pelicot Case
snippets: The debate over the change in legislation gained renewed urgency following the mass rape trial which shocked France last year.
French lawmakers have passed a law redefining what constitutes rape. The move comes in the wake of the Gisele Pelicot case, in which a woman was serially raped after being drugged.
The new legislation was adopted after dozens of men were convicted of raping Gisèle Pelicot while she was drugged by her husband.
titles: France enshrines need for consent into rape law in wake of Gisèle Pelicot case
France redefines rape in new sexual consent law
France Adds Consent to Its Rape Law After Yearslong Fight
summary: Following the mass rape trial of Gisèle Pelicot, which shocked France, lawmakers have passed new legislation redefining rape. This comes after Pelicot was serially raped after being drugged by her husband, leading to the conviction of dozens of men. The law aims to address and prevent such crimes more effectively.

titles: Microsoft says it’s recovering after Azure outage took down 365, Xbox, and Starbucks
Microsoft Azure is down, affecting 365, Xbox, Minecraft, and others
summary: Microsoft Azure experienced a significant outage, impacting services including Microsoft 365, Xbox, and Minecraft. This disruption comes one week after AWS issues affected many online services.

title: Newcastle vs Fulham, Cardiff Hosts Chelsea in Carabao Cup Quarters
snippets: Newcastle draw Fulham in the Carabao Cup quarter-finals, while League One side Cardiff City host Chelsea.
Carabao Cup holders Newcastle will host Fulham in the quarter-finals, while Arsenal will host fellow Londoners Crystal Palace.
titles: Holders Newcastle host Fulham & Cardiff face Chelsea in quarters
Carabao Cup holders Newcastle at home to Fulham in QFs as Arsenal host Palace
summary: In the Carabao Cup quarter-finals, Newcastle United will play against Fulham at home, and Cardiff City from League One will host Chelsea. Additionally, Arsenal is set to face Crystal Palace in another home match.

title: AOL Sold to Bending Spoons for $1.5 Billion in Historic Deal
snippets: AOL to be sold to Bending Spoons for roughly $1.5B Axios
Wednesday's news marks a new chapter for AOL, which was once one of the most recognized brands on the internet, known for its email service and "You've Got Mail" notification.
titles: AOL to be sold to Bending Spoons for roughly $1.5B - Axios
Bending Spoons to acquire AOL
summary: AOL, once a leading internet brand famous for its email service, is being sold to Bending Spoons for approximately $1.5 billion, marking a significant shift in the company's history.

title: "Global Report: Climate Tipping Points Near as Fossil Fuel Use Hits Record"
snippets: Global scientists warn that humanity is on the verge of crossing irreversible climate thresholds, with coral reefs already at their tipping point and polar ice sheets possibly beyond recovery. The Global Tipping Points Report 2025 reveals how rising temperatures could trigger a cascade of system col
Global use of fossil fuels rose to a new record last year, releasing even more greenhouse gases. Humanity is 'hurtling toward climate chaos,' scientists warn.
titles: Earth has hit its first climate tipping point, scientists warn
Humanity is on path toward 'climate chaos,' scientists warn
summary: Scientists warn humanity is nearing irreversible climate thresholds, with coral reefs at a tipping point and polar ice sheets possibly beyond recovery. The Global Tipping Points Report 2025 highlights the risk of cascading climate system collapses due to rising temperatures. Meanwhile, global fossil fuel use hit a new record last year, exacerbating greenhouse gas emissions and pushing humanity closer to climate chaos.

title: Glīd Wins TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, Secures $100K Prize
snippets: Glīd, which is trying to streamline cargo container logistics, has beaten out 199 other Startup Battlefield companies to take home $100,000.
geCKo Materials returned to the stage at TechCrunch Disrupt to debut new products as it pushes deeper into commercializing its tech.
If you’re not able to attend in person, the next best thing is to check out our livestream of the Disrupt Stage. Tune in right here starting now!
This is the third and final day of TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 at Moscone West in San Francisco. Register here to get a 50% discount and don't miss out on innovation and scaling.
titles: And the winner of Startup Battlefield at Disrupt 2025 is: Glīd
2024’s Startup Battlefield runner-up geCKo Materials reveals four new products at TechCrunch Disrupt
TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: How to watch the Startup Battlefield finale, Cluely, Solana, SF’s mayor
TechCrunch Disrupt 2025: Day 3
summary: Glīd won the Startup Battlefield competition at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, beating 199 other companies to secure a $100,000 prize. Meanwhile, geCKo Materials showcased new products, aiming to expand its commercial reach. The event, held at Moscone West in San Francisco, concluded its final day, offering a livestream for those unable to attend in person and a 50% registration discount for future participants.
